sentences: Poiss oli kehalt niru, lausa vilets.
context: The Estonian adjective 'vilets' describes something of poor quality, condition, or status. It can refer to physical health (a sick person), material possessions (worn-out clothes), abilities (poor skills), economic situation (meager conditions), or moral character (contemptible person). The word carries a strong sense of deficiency and inferiority across various contexts - from describing someone's poor health to criticizing the low quality of products or services.
